body:
Hi Subash, 

The second one is about a gcc error to compile pystan.  In documentation page from the pystan module, there is a workaround for this problem. For me, using Anaconda, I just type:
`conda install pystan -c conda-forge`

Besides that, you mentioned that you're using Python 3.6 but your log error says _**python3.7**_

> --compile --install-headers c:\users\skumar\appdata\local\temp\temp5_qlik-py-tools-4.0.zip\qlik-py-tools-4.0\qlik-py-env\include\site\python3.7\pystan" failed 

Check if are any problems with your envs.

Regards

Hi Nabeel/Hein
I am still seeing this error, while trying to uninstall the 3.7 and installing 3.6.8 python

Installing collected packages: pystan
Could not install packages due to an EnvironmentError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'c:\\users\\skumar\\appdata\\local\\temp\\temp6_qlik-py-tools-4.0.zip\\qlik-py-tools-4.0\\qlik-py-env\\Lib\\site-packages\\pystan\\stan\\src\\test\\test-models\\good\\function-signatures\\distributions\\univariate\\continuous\\scaled_inv_chi_square\\scaled_inv_chi_square_ccdf_log.stan'

I have one more doubt, if integration is successful, we should be able to see the Pandas, numpy in Qlik if my understanding is right?

Any thoughts on this

Regards
Subash Kumar

Hi Nabeel/Hein,

We are able to integrate the Python with Qlik Sense based on your instruction,

Now am trying to bring the pandas and numpy  python modules into the qlik
I just added the pandas in the Qlik-Py-Init batch file and started the Qlik-py-Start batch file, is it something correct approach

I am still not able to see pandas and numpy modules in qlik

Thank you so much for your input, really interesting and helpful

regards
Subash Kumar

I think you may have misunderstood the capabilities of this Server Side Extension (SSE). It provides functions built in Python which provide a specific capability to be used in Qlik. For e.g the Prophet function can produce a forecast. There is Python code behind the function that uses several libraries like fbprophet, pandas and numpy, but in Qlik you simply call the function in the expression editor or load script to produce a forecast without having to use any Python code.

It is possible to write Python script in Qlik and have it evaluated in the SSE, but this type of usage is not available with PyTools as mentioned in the [notes on the approach](https://github.com/nabeel-oz/qlik-py-tools#note-on-the-approach). 

If you want to build your own SSE the best place to start is here: https://github.com/qlik-oss/server-side-extension

Thank you so much Nabeel for the explanation, I am trying to bring the pandas and numpy libraries into qlik, but not sure how to start in github

Regards
Subash Kumar

Hi Nabeel,

I am just trying to setup the model with the below load script

[In]:
LOAD
    Model_Name,
    EstimatorArgs,
    ScalerArgs,
    ExecutorArgs
FROM [lib://qlik py testing/MODEL_INIT.xlsx]
(ooxml, embedded labels, table is MODEL_INIT);

[out]:
LOAD
    Model_Name,
    EstimatorArgs,
    ScalerArgs,
    ExecutorArgs
EXTENSION PythonTools.sklearn_Setup(In{Model_Name,EstimatorArgs,ScalerArgs,ExecutorArgs});

I am getting below error:
Started loading data
In << MODEL_INIT
Lines fetched: 1
The following error occurred:
Connector reply error: grpc::StatusCode::UNKNOWN: 'Exception iterating responses: dictionary update sequence element #0 has length 1; 2 is required'
The error occurred here:

Data has not been loaded. Please correct the error and try loading again.

Apologize if disturbing again

regards
Subash Kumar
The arguments you are passing are probably not in the required syntax. Check them against the documentation to be sure you are providing the correct keywords and separators.

Hi Nabeel,

Thank you for the response, just wanted to check with you on the Prophet function for forecasting, with below syntax, we tried connecting sample superstore data in qlik and tried to forecast the values based on ship date on monthly frequency), the formula is working but unable to see any predicted line
PyTools.Prophet([Ship Date],Sum(Profit),'freq=M')

Thank you for all your support and help

regards
Subash Kumar

Please look at the [usage documentation](https://github.com/nabeel-oz/qlik-py-tools/blob/master/docs/Prophet.md#use-prophet-with-your-own-app) for applying the function correctly. The expression looks ok but your app may miss some essential requirement such as passing the future periods to the SSE.

Hi Nabeel,

Thank you so much for your guidance, still I am not able to plot the prediction chart in qlik

Apologize, I am new to qlik and I am troubling you again and again, sorry for that. If you could help me on this, this would be really helpful.

1. Tried creating a new app having guidance of your app while data loading, 
2. We do not see any issues while doing data loading, but while ploting the chart with required dimensions and measures, unable to see chart
Dimensions: Order_date
Add Measures: Sum(Sales)
Add Measures: PyTools.Prophet(if(FORECAST_MONTH <= AddMonths(Max(Total [Order Month & Year]), $(vforecastperiod)), FORECAST_MONTH),

Also tried Dimensions: =if(FORECAST_MONTH <= AddMonths(Max(Total [Order Month & Year]), $(vforecastperiod)), FORECAST_MONTH)
Measures: Count({$<FORECAST_LINK_TYPE = {'Actual'}>} Distinct 'Order ID')
Add Measures: PyTools.Prophet(if(FORECAST_MONTH <= AddMonths(Max(Total [Order Month & Year]), $(vforecastperiod)), FORECAST_MONTH),
				Count({$<FORECAST_LINK_TYPE = {'Actual'}>} Distinct [Order ID]),
                'freq=MS, return=yhat')
				Count({$<FORECAST_LINK_TYPE = {'Actual'}>} Distinct [Order ID]),
                'freq=MS, return=yhat')

if you can share me your email id, I could share the qvf app I created in qlik.

Regards
Subash Kumar
9046147652

Hi Subash, in your latest post you're using FORECAST_DATE as the dimension, yet using FORECAST_MONTH in the measure. That is incorrect as the granularity of the data should match.

Also, if the error mentions the service not being available, you need to confirm that the connection to the SSE is working.

Hi Nabeel,

I am not sure how to share the app through github, that is the reason, I shared the above code for your view.
Regards
Subash Kumar

Hi Nabeel,

I am able to plot the values, from the below uploaded image, the first 2 columns are actual date(Order date) and sum(Sales) from sample superstore data, the next 2 columns are forecasted columns using the SSE extension, but still I feel the data is not populating correct, looks like join issue, Need your thoughts, if you could help me on this.

![Prophet_Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49568152/57337802-d89ed900-70f8-11e9-97b9-13c2aa038def.PNG)

Regards
Subash Kumar
nivi05subhash@gmail.com
(if you feel comfortable, could you please share me your email id), please apologize, if you feel disturbing.

Hi Subash, 

You are missing the set analysis expression described in the usage documentation: https://github.com/nabeel-oz/qlik-py-tools/blob/master/docs/Prophet.md#use-prophet-with-your-own-app

I'm only providing support for this project through GitHub, not via email. You can attach files to GitHub issues by dragging and dropping to a post. However, I will usually only look at an app if there is a bug in the SSE.

Hi Nabeel, 

Sure Nabeel, will check as per your guidance but unable to attach the app file for your view in github, I will look into the code again and see what am missing, any idea how can I share the app in github, tried to drag and drop the app, it populates that we don't support the file type

please confirm, what should be my dimension, is that I have to add Order_date which is the original column from the input shet or I should have the forecast date which is derived in qlik as dimension,
similarly measures will be sum(sales) from the original input sheet and I have to add one more measure with pytool library as the forecasted measure.

regards
Subash K

Hi Nabeel,

I am able to do forecasting  now based on different frequencies I am trying to implement logistic regression, any thoughts which documentation I would need to refer now from SSE
Thank you so much for your guidance
Regards
Subash Kumar

You would need to refer to the machine learning section of the usage documentation.
https://github.com/nabeel-oz/qlik-py-tools#usage

I'm closing this issue as all questions have been addressed.
